text: Our stay at Jineng Villas was truly memorable. We were greeted at the airport as part of the service they offer and from the warm welcome at check-in we felt that Jineng was a tropical home away from home. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Spent many hours relaxing in and around the private pool during our 5 night stay and the water was the perfect temperature. The Villas offer a massage service in the room that is professional and great value. We stayed during Nyepi and this was not an inconvenience as meals were pre-ordered and brought to us in the Villa. The daily breakfast options are healthy and tasty. The Villas are approx 20 minute walk to Seminyak main streets and the Villas offer a free shuttle service, but there are lots of restaurants, spas and shops within 5 minute walk. We used the hotels driver on our last day for 8 hours to take us to our next hotel in Ubud and also to do sight seeing tour. He was very friendly, helpful and had good suggestions on places to see in the area. We would definitely stay at Jineng Villas again and will be recommending it to my family and friends. The experiences at Jineng Villas makes us want to return to Bali again soon!!!

text:
It's always a bit of a risk choosing a place to stay from the pictures on websites.  Most everything looks pretty good.  The customer reviews paint the truest picture however.  For Jineng those written reviews were highly praiseworthy with the odd whine, but you can't please everyone, even when it's near to perfect.  We arrived, and at first it seemed like an out of the way location from the main strip, but it actually wasn't once we found the maze of laneways to take you to where all the restaurants and shops are.  Check in was charming, staff were delightful, and we were escorted along a walkway arched with bamboo which was beautiful in itself.  Only second villa back from the road but completely quiet, and lovely ambience particularly at night.  The moment of truth is when you walk through the gate and hope to see what you came for (especially when you're going to be there for a week), an oasis of calm and the retreat you need.  It did not disappoint.  Nice big generous private pool, and beautiful bedrooms with really comfortable beds.  The living area was separate from the bedrooms and air conditioned.  Most I have stayed at are open air, which is also nice, but it was good to have a retreat from the heat other than your bedroom when you needed to chill.
It was more than walking distance (though do-able) to places like Breeze and other renowned restaurants, but the hotel provided a free service to anywhere you wanted to go daily.  If their private car was otherwise occupied, e.g. with airport pick-ups, they would arrange a taxi, direct them to where you wanted to go and pick up the tab.
I had trouble getting connected to internet initially and the staff were prompt and amazing at getting it sorted.
I will certainly go again, and in fact my travelling companion in February booked the same place for April to go again with other friends.
title: As good as it looks in the pictures

text:
Stayed 5 nights with a friend in a 2 bedroom (villa b)

Villas
Liked the fact that the living room/kitchen were closed off but separate from the bedrooms. Meant we had a place to cool off and escape the heat and inevitable Mosquitos. Kitchen was well equipt and water was replenished daily. 

2 bedrooms were identical, one on ground floor with access to the pool and one directly above with a balcony so no arguments over who gets the better room :-)

Pool was clean and large enough to war and paddle around. Only thing that I would say could be improved would be to get sun beds that could fully recline. The beds while funky looking and fairly comfortable to sit in meant you could never lie on your stomach. 

Bathrooms were large and clean, DVD player and TV in each bedroom with lots of storage and working space. 

Breakfast
Great choice of breakfast cooked
To order. My friend and I ate at different times and breakfast always arrived on time served with a smile. Ordered a few items off
The breakfast menu - everything was delicious 

Service 
Fantastic! All staff are very warm and friendly from receptionists to housekeeping staff who came not just to make up rooms but returned every evening to spray the rooms. 
Receptionists took every opportunity to address us by name and to do everything to make our stay enjoyable. When my friend was unable to connect to common wifi for a work call, they installed a separate modem in our villa. 
Free shuttle service or taxi to seminyak was a lovely idea

Location 
On a quiet street within walking distance from the main shopping and dining street and 15 minute walk from double 6 beach. 

There are 2 bicycles available for hotel guests which were a great idea but I didn't manage to make use of. 

It was hard to leave and i can't wait to return next month.
title: So good, booked to return as soon as I got home!

text:
We had a wonderful time at the Jineng Villas and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for my family in March 2015. We had a 3 year old and a 10 month old and they were very accommodating. We requested a cot and high chair, which were waiting in our villa when we arrived. The breakfast was great and our 3 year old loved the pool. One of the reasons that we booked this villa is that every living area can be closed off from the outside, meaning keeping the mozzies away at night, but they weren't that bad. The staff also lay mozzie coils and give a quick spray every evening. The drop off service was also great and they didn't mind that the 10 month old got cranky waiting in traffic. If the vans were out then they would organise and pay for a taxi if going to the local area. The villas were clean and they even picked up some of the toys we brought that were scattered around and placed neatly.  We had the front 2 bedroom villa near the road but couldn't hear any noise. Its also a short walk to the main road through Seminyak and we did this regularly to change money and visit shops. I will book again if its just the wife and I or the family again. 
Ryan

text:
I rarely write a poor review on the property I stayed in during my vacation. However, this time I am rather disappointed with this place after reading all the positive reviews. Probably it is only my villa which has the issues.

The cons.
This being a 3 year old (approximately) property, badly require some serious maintenance. A few items in the room are not working. The water does not drain well after the shower. The bathtub requires at least two rounds of cleaning before brownish water stop coming out from the tap. The hairdryer malfunctioned on the first night we used it. There are many huge cockroaches in our villa. Everyday we would kill two.

The Pros
The rate is affordable for the size and swimming pool in the villa. The staff are very friendly and respond immediately to our requests every time. The breakfast was served cold on the first morning and we requested for hot breakfast subsequently and our requests were met. The one way transport to nearby places were provided. The staff reacted instantly and apologetically to our complaint on the cockroach issues.

Overall I think there are plenty of other accommodation options around, therfore I would think twice before I come back.

text: Let me start off by saying that it took me weeks and weeks to book a villa in seminyak because I like to make sure the place can offer the facilities and services  we needand I like to read through alot of  reviews before making the final decision. Jineng Villas did not disappoint.   The villas were beautiful and had everything you could need. The  kitchen and sitting area is closed off which is a big plus considering it gets very hot and there are alot of mosquitoes around. The pool is a great size and depth with a lovely outdoor area to relax.  The bedroom and bathroom are very spacious. The staff are absolutely amazing and will do everything in their power to make sure you have a relaxed holiday.  Breakfast served daily in the room was a perfect touch.  I loved putting my order through each night and looked forward to a private breakfast delivered at the time we chose each morning.  The drop off service in seminyak is also fabulous.  The staff will arrange thier own service or a paid taxi drop off to anywhere in seminyak you'd like to go.  There was never any waiting around to get to places.  It's about a 10minute walk into the strip of shops or a short bike ride.  We enjoy walking and we loved borrowing the bikes to go around,  so no problem for us. The villas are also very private with high walls and lovely trees. Also free drinks in the mini bar and free DVDs =awesome. And we had in-room massages as part of our stay package which was so lovely too. No complaints at all. We will definitely stay here again.

What a horrible idea it was to trust this hotel with my engagement plans. I traveled from Gold Coast, Australia with my partner on a surprise trip. I planned everything down to the tee and had even requested the villas to help make the room a little extra special for our arrival as I had planned to pop the question once we arrived. Let's just say the service was appalling, the staff gave away the proposal before I had a chance to ask my partner. 

During our stay our expensive toiletries were broken, the manager Ms Line was rude, unapologetic and very unhelpful. The food was below standard. The linen was off white and the bath was dirty with sand in the bottom. The staff seemed stoned or not with it. I would never stay here again or ever recommend for anyone to stay here.
title: Don't stay here!

text: This is a great place to stay if you are looking for affordable accommodation with full villa facility including private swimming pool, jacuzzi in the bathroom and air-conditioned living room. My wife and I had compared other villas in Bali within the same price range and we found that The Jineng Villas was the only villa that offered air-conditioned living room in that range. Furthermore, we were afraid of staying in a villa with an open space living room especially in Bali because of mosquitoes. Thus, the air-conditioned living room was definitely a plus point and at least we were able to relax in the living room during the evenings without direct contact with mosquitoes as compared to open space living room. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. They were willing to accommodate to our request for late checkout prior to our departure for the airport to take a quick shower even though the place was fully booked on that day.

text: My partner and I shared a wonderful 12 night experience at the Jineng Villas, 1 - 12 October. Fabulously close to all the venues we frequently visit, and new ones we discovered! Bintang Supermarket is only a 15 minute stroll down the lane next to the villas, bicycles are available as is the 'taksi' rank just down the road. Staff are so welcoming and seem to enjoy their work and helping visitors wherever possible.  Villas are clean and provide a good base to work from. Hot water readily available and linen/towels always clean and refreshed everyday. Photos give a very true representation of the villas, don't be disappointed! A couple of things a 'westerner' would probably like to see provided, something to hang wet bathers on and more crockery/glassware options to be provided. The pool can be a little difficult for the less agile to get out (please be wary with small children!). Highly recommend staying with Jineng VIllas
title: Oasis in busy Seminyak

text:
My husband and I stayed at Jineng Villas in early October for 4 nights. It was our first trip to Bali and we hit the jackpot with this accomodation. We had an early flight into Denpasar arriving at 7.30am. The driver from the villa was waiting out the front for pick up back to Seminyak. Because it was so early we were expecting to drop our luggage off and go and explore until check in but they checked us in on the spot and showed us to our amazeballs villa. What ever we requested from the front desk, from dinner reservations to spa reservations, they couldn't help us enough. Being always greeted with a smile from each and every staff member we encountered made our stay there so wonderful. 
The complimentary transport into anywhere in Seminyak was a fantastic feature we used many times. 
Our only slight disappointment was with the room service food. It is prepared by an off site cafe down the road and for a container not even half full of chips, 6 nuggets and some bruschetta it was overpriced and did not come close to meeting our already low expectations. 
Overall we had a fantastic stay at Jineng and will be recommending it to family and friends who will be visiting Seminyak in the future.
title: A fantastic first trip to Bali!

text:
We had a beautiful stay at Jineng Villas. We located made our booking via Wotif through convenience and had no idea what a treat we had gotten ourselves in for.
The Villa was beautiful, clean and tidy and the staff were friendly and helpful to boot.
Rooms were cleaned daily, with staff taking note of when you left to ensure that it was completed in your absence. Though if you were in your room, and still wanted it clean, the staff were very considerate of you.
Only difficulties were communicating by phone with reception as a result of the language barrier, face to face is much easier and also the floors were quite slippery when wet, though we didn't have any accidents there were a few near misses.

Facilities were fantastic, anything that wasn't in your room you could ask for and it was never too much trouble. No extra charges at the end - a problem we've had previously in Bali.

All transfers within Seminyak were free - this was really handy!
title: Beautiful

text:
We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children. Perfect accomodation for us in Seminyak.
Brilliant staff. Never waited any more than 2 minutes for transport. Housekeeping to exceptionally 
High standards. Pool crystal clear . Morning breakfast on time every time. We would know , as we stayed 9 nights . 5 minutes to Bintang Supermarket for supplies. 10 minutes to eat street in Seminyak by Villa transport or taxi. 3 Televisions . Massive bathrooms with spas . The front of house staff perfect. (Love to have all the staff working for me. What great role models for my kids ).
Good value for money. They celebrated their 1 year anniversary with beautiful musicians at the front entrance. Whenever we left, we were treated with warmth and a smile.  Whenever we returned from being out , we were treated with a smile and a heartfelt welcome back home.
We were even given a surprise birthday cake for my sons birthday.
Beautifull people. We'll presented property with staff who care about you.
Congratulations to the whole operation. Recommend Yudi tattoo ( a driver who provides transport for the Villa ). The villas are modern ,clean, large , we'll maintained , private , secure , and comfortable.
Bagus.

Mr Gavin

text:
Economic but spacious and clean pool villa. Although the hotel doesn't have any common facilities (e.g. restaurants, large shared swimming pool, gym, bars; as far as we know), this doesn't affect any of our feeling of staying there, because our room including pool, kitchen, TV room, etc is just so nice enough. Breakfasts and drinks are good. More importantly, the hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. Our stay is very comfortable. 

They offer free car transfer, so you can easily go to the night markets, grocery stores or other shops nearby (they're indeed just very near ~10mins walk, but note that the walk to there, especially at night, is not that easy because of poor pavement, busy traffic and darkness; Anyway, the local people said that the area is safe - which is true at least in our experience).

Two, perhaps negative, comments:
- Insects are around in the room, but I guess you can't find a insect-free (esp, with pool) hotel in Bali.
- Not at beach area but you can use their free drive to the nearby beach I guess (not tried).
- No good view, but you can't expect more with such a good price for a pool-villa.

In general, we enjoy our stay there very much.
title: Very nice stay

text: The staffs were excellent at Jineng Villas, so lovely and helped a lot for us first timers to Bali. The place itself is close to the main street, about 10 mins walk or $2-$3 cab ride to the center of main road, and about $5 to hot spots like Potato head. The villa offers complimentary transportation either with their own van or pay the cab for us if its reasonable distance, they organise it all so you can simply step out to the reception and tell them where you would like to go and you are off in a minute or two, no hassle with communication with taxi drivers at all. The villa itself was very clean all the time, breakfasts were nice and generous in size from a good range menu and didn't get us sick at all! The villa was nice and quiet and great to have the private pool to ourselves. I can't imagine a better experience here for visiting the first time. Big thank you to the lovely staffs there, highly recommended and will definitely go back!

text:
To start, the pick up from airport once we found our driver from the throngs of all the other transport drivers was welcome and friendly, cold towel and water supplied.After a short trip to the villa and a speedy checkin(around 1 am)and breakfast organised for that morning, we were taken to our villa.
Although the villa share a common wall and the private pools are literally side by side,we had no occupants next door for the first few days,so had no issues with noise.But when we did have occupants you can hear them when sitting out by the pool.The pool is wonderful, a must when staying in Bali.
The rooms were nice although starting to show some wear from the weather(definatly not an issue)Spa bath was great, not sure if it was me as I like my water steaming hot, but the  hot water temp was tepid,even after asking to be looked at by the maitenence crew. Air conditioning was great and welcoming,villa was always cleaned.pancakes a must for breakfast,and also omlette.
The staff were excellent, they went out of their way to accommandate any request,and the free shuttle into Seminyak was a bonus(to far to walk if you are not young) in saying this a taxi was cheap and plentiful to get to and from the villa.
It was our wedding anniversary and the staff had recommended a resturant for dinner(La Lucciola) fantastic sunset and meal on the beach 15min away) on our return we were surprised with swan towels and rose stems, heart made of flower petals on the floor,then to find the spa filled with water and floating petal with I luv U spelt in them,then found a beautiful choc heart cake with happy anniversary in the fridge. this was heart felt and made us feel very special,again thank you to all the staff.
All in all we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this villa if you are looking for a villa close to Seminyak with private pool.
title: Great service,private pool,nice rooms,good location

text:
We stayed at the Jineng Villas for 7 days. This was a 2 bedroom villa although we used only 1 room. A large dining/kitchen/lounge with tv and good aircon was part of the complex. Our bedroom had a comfortable king bed with large Tele ang good aircon. Ample hanging and cupboard space with a large bathroom and quality floor tiling everywhere. 
The location here is central to both Legion and Seminyak with the Bintang Market only a 5 minute walk.
Only drawback is poor internet during the day but good early morning and at night.
The Villas need some maintenance and a little more effort to brighten the place up. 
In general more than happy to stay here again and as usual all staff are friendly and attentive to their duties. 
Well done all.
title: Roomy and Quiet

text: Very good experience during 1 week stay in this place,, The best location in Seminyak and access to Double Six Beach can be reached only by walking, friendly staff and very good service, they don't blame small things and don't even ask for compensation when my child accidentally breaks plates and glasses as well as making the curtains dirty,, I highly recommend this place when you are in Seminyak Bali
title: Comfort and homey Villa in Seminyak Bali

text:
Staying 4 nights and chose because of reviews. Jineng Villas are rated I believe using the “Bali scale” because they are definitely not 4+ star rated accommodation. 
The rooms are spotlessly clean but the building itself hasn’t seen much maintenance. The pool is unusable for us because the only step in is 600mm from the top! I actually fell in and had trouble getting out! So for the older person or children this is an extreme hazard. Bathroom shower area mouldy tiles everywhere and a lack of ammenities including toilet paper!
The food is passable but the servings are small (and we’re not big eaters either). Be sure to ask for milk for your fridge too.
Overall the Jineng I’d consider to be a 3 star saved by polite and welcoming staff and a comfortable bed.
title: Nice but....

text:
Very relaxing stay at Jineng Villas. We stayed for 13 nights in September 2018 in Villa J, and would thoroughly recommend staying here.

The villas are in a quiet laneway away from the busy streets, though these are only a five minute walk away. Across the road is a small 24hr Circle K which sells a range or drinks, snacks, and toiletries. Next door is a spa, and a couple of nice restaurants including a pizza place, and the Orchard pub are within a two minute walk. 

Our villa was located around a private pool, with a dining/lounge/kitchen room located off to one side via a sliding door. At the end of the pool another sliding door leads to your bedroom/bathroom. These two rooms are not connected internally, but instead a small deck and pathway connect these two rooms. In between is a second small bathroom which contains a shower, basin and toilet. The small deck contains a small table and two lounging chairs with a small drying rack, and a basket with two umbrellas.

The bedroom contains the usual accompaniments including a wardrobe, safe, TV, desk, phone, etc. It also came with a DVD player, a plug convertor, and an electronic mosquito repellent plug. The bathroom contains a bath, separated shower, toilet, and basin. A hair dryer and toiletries are supplied.

The kitchen contains a full size fridge, toaster, jug, cutlery, cups, glasses, wine/bottle opener, chopping board, and a pan and pot. Their are two gas hobs for cooking. There is also a 4 seat dining table, a couch and a second TV in this room.

You could get a full service clean each day, or you can just ask for things to be replaced such as towels or water etc.. The room itself was reasonably tidy, though had a little wear and tear. The curtains could have done with a clean, but this was a biggie to us. Some other reviewers have complained about the bed, but we though this was good.

Breakfast is order a la carte style the day before and delivered to your room at the time you have specified the next morning. There is a large variety of choice. Also as we had a scoopon deal for part of our stay we could order lunch or dinner off the menu room service style. All the breakfasts and other meals we had were great. I have attached photos of the menus with this review for those interested.

Staff over all were really friendly and helpful if asked. A great bonus was the free drop off to anywhere in the local area. As other reviewers have mentioned if the villa van is not available they will organise and pay for a taxi to take you instead which was great. A turrn down service was also provided around dusk where each of the rooms were sprayed, curtains pulled, and bed made (if it is unmade).

Lastly the pool itself was great. It is reasonably deep, with no shallow end. It has a ledge running down the side which acts as a single step. Those with mobility issues, or if you are a bit olderr might have difficulties getting out of the pool, though we had no issues.
title: Relaxing stay

text: We did 7 days using a Scoopon offer. The rooms are lovely and having the seperate living/dining room is great. There is no restaurant on the premises so the lovely thing is your meals are delivered to your villa, we found that wonderful as there was no rush to be up showered ,dressed and at breakfast...made for a really relaxing time.  The pools is 7 metres long and nice and deep so not a small plunge pool, the only comment I will make is it can be a little difficult to get out of , i have a knee injury and managed okay but a handrail attached to the post at the end would be helpful.  There is a huge bathroom with spa bath and seperate toilet/ shower out by the pool, the kitchen comes with a full size fridge and over the road is  Circle K which sells Bintang and vodka cruisers etc. The best place to eat is 2 minutes walk down the lane to The Orchard whic boasts the best fish n chips in Bali and they are correct, great food ans music and open till 12pm. The staff at the villas are young but they are so friendly and professional and nothing is too much trouble. I highly recommend here if you want quiet, relaxed and privacy..
title: A quiet and relaxing time.

text: We cannot say average but neither can we say very good, we are here on a Scoopon Deal for 7 days and to be fair we wouldn't want to have paid full price, contrary to what other people have said in their reviews it definitely is not fantastic,  it's ok, not bad but not fantastic. Our villa I is a 1 bedroom villa with a lounge/kitchen/diner, our deal included daily breakfast which is adequate,  lunch or dinner each day which is limited to the same main menu which again if you like is adequate, I actually intended to cook on an odd occasion but with only a small saucepan and small frypan no microwave no basins then it would prove difficult. The minibar consisted of 2 cokes & 2 lemonades. Complimentary bottled water is provided. The villa has potential but unfortunately needs some maintenance/decorating, the curtains are in very bad need of laundering, the large king bed is hard and creaky and the pool is dangerously deep at 150cm right through with no low end, very difficult to get in and out with no steps or handrail. No pool fench for families with small children. The villa was cleaned everyday with fresh towels and i actually think the bed was chaged each day too. I wouldn't put anyone off from coming here but i certainly wouldn't rely on the fantastic reviews either. In my opinion it always deoends on the expectations of the individual and what we are used to at home, for me personally i expect the same standards as at home or hopefully better than at home but inveriabaly this rarely happens. Today i have just witnessed the housekeeper cleaning our villa, she carries a box with her cleaning cloths, sprays etc and she took out a toilet brush to scrub the inside of our toilet she then just put it back in the box touching the cloths with it, one of those cloths she actually cleaned the kitchen with.  OMG now we know why we get gastric infections and all of this time we've thought it was due to the water or food. Surely to god if they are to use a toilet brush it should be kept in each villa and not shared between every single villa. I don't blame the lovely girl, i blame the manager as he is responsible for the correct training and cleaning procedures. Talk about what the eye doesn't see the heart doesn't grieve about!
title: Between Average and Very Good

text:
We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa for 4 nights . This is a peaceful quite place away from the noisy street even though the market is 5 min walk away. There is a 24/7 store just outside the villa where you get almost everything eatables,Liquor , cigarettes etc. Double six beach is at a walk-able distance of 10-15 minutes where you have lots of dining options at the shore. There is a Taxi stand and two wheeler for rent just outside the villa. About the villa- Villa has a parking in front of it and we were parking our two wheeler which we took on rent during our stay there. The place is very clean and tidy. The pool in the villa is just amazing with the pool lights switched on till 12 am. Pool was cleaned daily and the water was so clear. For the sake of saying a negative point (not very serious though)- the water pressure was slightly low especially in the shower.  Villa which we took had one bedroom two bathroom of which one was pretty big with a separate shower area and a Jacuzzi. It had a drawing hall with Kitchen attached to it and of course an amazing pool. The pathway to villa is really good surrounded by bamboo which looks really cool at night with all those lights.
I would recommend this place for travelers who wish to have some private and amazing experience during their vacation in Bali.
title: Amazing Romantic Experience

Padma is 5 star and Jineng 4 star - which would I choose again? Jineng in a heartbeat. Safe, extremely clean, gorgeous and you can't beat the staff who are an absolute asset!!!

text: My family had a great 6 night stay in a 2 bedroom villa. The complimentary airport pick up and drop off was smooth and the villa also offer drop off in seminyak area which we used most days. It's a nominal cab fee to return. Bintang shopping centre is a 10 min walk away so restaurants and retail stores are not far away. The villa location is quiet where you don't hear too much traffic. The villa itself was very clean modern had 2 rooms (2 storey) each having king size beds massive bathrooms in each TV DVDs. It also has a separate lounge dining area kitchen large fridge. Each room has sliding doors and great aircon. Pool is 9m by 3m.  Staff are polite and always willing to help and assist with any issues. Breakfast is served at your villa and it brought a nice start to our day. The villa also had a meal delivery service for lunch or dinner if you prefer to stay in which I used and enjoyed. Looking forward to returning in the near future.

text:
We stayed in Villa E for 2 nights.  Everything about this hotel interior was gorgeous and nicely done up.  

The private pool is big, compared to some other villas we saw online.  Even though there were occupants in the villas next to us, we couldn't hear a thing, so the villa is really nicely intimate and lovely.  

The bathrooms were just awesome.  We were all squealing "oooohhhh gorgeous!!" when the staff were giving us a room tour.  (Check-in is IN your villa, btw.)  

Free refreshments (can drinks etc) for one round.  

Breakfast was good.  They will set up the whole table for you in your villa at a time of your convenience.  But they don't do early breakfast (we checked out at 7am, and they only start serving breakfast at 7.30am... they refuse to do an early breakfast for us.)

The cons :

*  Jineng Villas will charge you for babycot - USD15 per night.  
*  The shuttle service is only drop-off.  No pick-up.  You have to take a cab back to the villa, so please ensure you have the address with you coz most taxi-drivers had NO idea where Jineng Villas is located at.
*  The location is really awful, in some back alley or something.... it was so dark, you basically cannot walk anywhere at all.  
*  Pool is kinda deep, around 1.5m, so if you are bringing kids who can't swim, make sure you bring some floats.  
*  Lots of insects, but heard that is inevitable in villas in Bali.  

Most importantly, Jineng Villas please update your contact information!!  We tried sooo hard to contact them to inform them of some changes in our booking, and only upon reaching the villa were we informed that the contact info on their websites were wrong!!
title: AWESOME!

text:
Im half way into my stay and it is my first time in Bali. Overall i would have to say the accommodation and level of service from lower level staff have been superb and super hands on.
The complex itself gives a very new vibe and i would say that i would definitely come back with only some minor hold backs.
The location itself is decent. It is right next to the main strip though it is advised that if you are into buying cheap and replica items then your at prime location. Having said that it isnt exactly walking distance if you are not use to the heat.
The staff are super attentive and do definitely feel like royalty with their above and beyond attitude. That cant be said the same for the higher manager. During my tenure I would call her the smiling wolf. Almost all staff here give you the perception of honesty but I felt her desire to up sell for additional revenue rubbed me the wrong way. i.e. It was clear to me getting from point x to point y may only take 20 mins, but to test waters Id ask once again and though a staff was about to confirm I was correct, a nudge and talk over to say it took double the time. Another incident would be the hiring of the hotel car only needing 5 hours she would try sell me 8 AFTER being told by the actual driver it costs 100k less. That aside i do stand patient if there are misunderstanding with general staff as english is not their mother tongue. 
As for amenities, personal preference would be body wash over soup. The shower head does lack abit of water pressure and hot water does take a while. In terms of breakfast or other food orders, it is operated by a cafe near by. My stay came from discount vouchers therefore breakfast was free, so i guess you pay for what you get so dont expect too much. Paid component is of value but dont expect it to be Michelin quality.
Cant say enough about how great the staff less manager is...pool is fantastic..taxis can be unsure where you stay so make sure you have net access to guide them...
will be hitting up the massages in the next few days..so maybe more to come..but hope for a strong finish!

Thats my 2 cents thus far^^
title: Thus far...

text:
We loved our stay at Jineng Villas. 
Great location, quiet, large fridge for all your villa snacks & copias amounts of Bingtang. 
Breakfast basic but enough after all your in bali if you want a 5 star buffet breakfast go to 
W retreat and get it.. 
Staff were accomidating & friendly & even went to the Bingtang supermarket to provide coloring in books for our daughter after she called for room service, hahaha. 
Love the layout of the Villa as we were able to sit in the dinning area at night and drink & make as much noise as we like whilst our daughter slept in the adjacent bedroom uninterupted.. . 

villas are a litle tired bits of paint missing here  & there and the rug in the main dining room was a little dirty. They just need a fresh coat of paint, and a little bit of love the new management were painting the office & entrance during our stay so im sure that the villas will be given some love as well. 
as for the spa/ jacuzzi in our villa it would have taken 5 days to fill as all bali goers would know the water pressure is not the best. for some this may be an issue but you have the pool for swimming why would you fill up a bath tub? 
The beds are devine our king size bed swallowed us whole & even the single bed provided as an optional extra for our daughter was above & beyond a normal bed. 
villa was always clean, linen clean & the bath & pool towels replaced every morning where fluffy & smelt lovely. 
only one thing i would higly suggest for the new management company is to provide room service to the villas as Breakfast is the only meal they supply. 
I just feel you need to have the option on those days you want to laze around the pool to call room service for a burger or a light snack & a few cocktails..it doesnt have to be a big menu but having that option for me would tick all the boxes. 

As for those whom complained about bugs just get some mozi coils & burn them at dusk if you are swiimming & you can also contact Baby Bali hire theyll also deliver mozi repelant to your villa this is a great option for those with sensative skin as its all natural. 

we will be returning to the Jineng Villas again.
title: FAMILY GETAWAY OCTOBER 2013

text:
What we loved about it is the villas' style and atmosphere. The design was very modern while the furnishings still give the villa a traditional touch. Once you enter the gate to your private villa, you are welcomed by the pool to your right, which was especially nice at night. The entertainment/living/dining room to the left is very spacious. The bedroom/toilet at the far end was very roomy and comfortable. The toilet, especially the bathtub, was huge and clean. And yes, some of the reviews are correct in saying that the toilet gives a weird smell, especially during the first day. But somehow, you get used to it, so it gets lost after a few hours. Just make sure you bring insect repellents. For some reason, we got lots of insect bites (not sure though if they were from the hotel or from outside). The location is far enough from the busy strip near Kuta beach, but near enough for a nice 15-30min stroll. The long walk from the reception to your villa is refreshing in the morning but rather stressful after a long day. 

Staff were friendly, generally. But probably due to the language difference, they couldn't seem to understand what we wanted. Breakfast took almost an hour late. We asked for power adaptors, but for some reason, they gave us writing pens. The massage time, thus the cost, was doubled. Asking for directions was such a hassle, we just had to rely on Google Maps. 

Booked this hotel from a dealsite, so we got a discount and a lot of perks. Really really good deal. But seeing the original prices in the website, it's rather expensive than what I would have paid for without the deal.
title: Very nice with lots of "buts"

text: After having a lovely stay in Ubud, we headed down to seminyak to The Jineng for th last 4 nights. Its conveniently close to the airport. What an utter disappointment. The check in was fine took few minutes and we were escorted to the room. On first glance you think this looks good, private pool and all. But as soon you walk round the rooms you think when was the last time this place was properly cleaned?! The toilets were probably the biggest put off they had stains an dirt all around, disgusting! The floors were Really dusty. The breakfast is mediocre to put it nicely. We asked for an iron and they told us they only have one and is currently in another room, we'll try bring you one tomorrow. The staff couldnt care less. We asked reception to change some money to smaller bills for a taxi and they said they don't keep money there. We ordered breakfast at 9 everyday and they kept calling us at 0730am telling us breakfast was there. Towels were not consistent and they were worn out and with huge stains. The lights in pool weren't working. The showers do not get proper hot water and the bathtub was so dirty we did not dare set foot in it. Were do I finish? The location is not excellent though we didn't mind it. We have to give it to one of the staff called AGU hes a real sweetheart. The rest of the staff are indifferent and dont speak proper english. The front of the hotel looks like a dump site. Not worth the money. The place does have potential but is in dire need of new managment and staff. Total Rip off. We have travelled through Asia extensively, we are used to geckos and mosquitos, taking into consideration we travel for work. But this is complete waste of money, do look elsewhere.
title: Do not waste your money!

text:
Bought a Groupon for a 3D2N stay at Nunia Boutique villa but could not get a room during our stipulated dates and the management was kind enough to let us stay at Jineng Villa (comparable and also at Seminyak area) instead of wasting the groupon. 

I really love Jineng Villa. The place is clean and private! All their staffs are very friendly. I requested to drive the buggy car one noon and their staff remembered and allowed me to drive subsequently!  I enjoyed the experience as I don't get to drive that in Singapore! Unless my job requires me to. Hahaha... anyway their breakfast is simple but nice and has quite a variety to choose from. The pool is clean but sun is not shining the whole pool. Good for me who doesn't wish to get too tanned but bad for my friend who wants to get herself burnt. As such, our bikinis and towel can't dry even after a day. 

The connection was really bad at our room (room N). My conclusion is it's too far from the office as its the 2nd last room. Unless you really can't live without internet (facebook, instagram etc), it's not too big of an issue. I mean, you go there to chill and relax with you family, lover or friends, you don't have to stick to your phone that frequently. 

Location of the villa is not very fantastic but they do provide complimentary airport transfer and shuttle service to the beach and some shopping area so I have no complaints. Even if you want to walk out to the main road, it's only about a 10-15 minute walk. You just need to turn right from the villa and walk all the way straight. There is a minimart if you turn right again when you reach the main road, else you can also buy from the locals' minimart which is just 5 minute walk from the villa. Finding food is not that difficult too.

dining area is very stuffy, guess the air conditioning wasnt functioning well but it doesnt really matter to us as we are only there for breakfast. The other times were spent chilling or having meals by our private pool. The fridge there works well. There are stoves but no pots and pans, in case you want to cook something. 

Many mosquitoes but there is something called insect repellent so it doesn't matter. You want the trees and plants to add on to the privacy feel, you bear with it. 

Will come back again if my budget allows!
title: excellent service

text:
My wife and I did a fair bit of research before deciding on The Jineng. Everyone advised us to stay in Seminyak and not stay in Kuta. We are both in our 50s and wanted a private villa with our own pool and also the budgets for such a place do vary quite a bit - we paid approximately $150 a night - you can pay a lot more if you wish.
We arrive at the airport and were promptly met by our driver who was holding our names up on a board and driven to the villas. There we were greeted by the staff who immediately offered us some "orange juice" which tasted strangely like cordial - I had one sip and reminded myself of Bali Belly and declined to drink the rest.
We sorted out the usual formalities of paper work etc and were driven by the Golf Buggy up to our villa - a whole 100 metres away ha ha. We opened the gate and it really was like it appears in the photos on here. It was extremely pleasant. The first room on our right was lovely, clean and quite large - considering we would only really use it for breakfast etc but it also had a toilet and shower. The fridge wasn't a small bar fridge - a full size fridge which was quite pleasing really. There were drinks in the fridge but you had to pay for them. Then they showed us the bedroom/bathroom with a spa. This room again was quite large with plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space. 2 tvs, one in each room but no  DVD player - which I found a little odd. As we were unpacking one of the staff came back with 3 bintangs (hot) - these were our complimentary arrival drinks (I'm sure it said 6 - perhaps I misread this).
The location is probably a 5 minute walk to the main street that goes from Kuta to Seminyak and another 10 minute walk to the beach - winding through all the shops etc. I quite enjoy walking so I found it quite pleasing actually. However if you wish to as we found out after about 4 days you can take the shuttle to the beach and the Jineng has its own sunbeds on the beach - no charge - There is a guy there who looks after them and he was very helpful and quite pleasant - if you use this service it will save you about $10 a day. We used to lay there on the chairs - leave our things behind and go off and have lunch at one of the restaurants and nothing was taken while we were away.
All in all I would say The Jineng was quite good - the only issue we had was the smell from the toilet but you get around that. Also the mozzies but again - take some coils light them at sunset and you won't be bothered. Breakfast was quite adequate I couldn't understand some of the fuss by the comments on here about breakfast - if what they gave you didn't fill you up - you must be a big eater I guess. Would I go back? - No but then I rarely go back to the same place - I like trying different hotels/countries etc. Overall it was a good holiday and we enjoyed it quite much.
title: Enjoy The Serenity

text: The general face-to-face service of the staff is top-notch. Front desk staff Evi was very helpful and cheerful all the time. She helped arranged our complimentary airport pickup, provide plenty of useful information for first-time visitors, etc. Location was quiet and going anywhere will require a cab. The not-so-good-quality of the furnishings are getting obvious and showing their age. Water pressure from certain taps are weak. Some stains are obvious. Biggest bug of them all will be the below-average standard from their housekeeping department, but they are really observant to our drinking needs and provide plenty of bottled water everyday. Thumbs up to that!
title: Value for $

photos.caption: View from dining/living area out to the private pool

text:
We stayed at Jineng Villas in a 1  bedroom for 11 nights. The staff very attentive and professional. We were met at the airport as arranged, and given 3 cold Bintangs. The Villa was certainly up to scratch, with lovely bedroom,with lots of drawers and cupboard space. the separate living dining was well appointed with a full size fridge and kitchenette. No cooking utensils in site but we did not really want any anyway. Maybe some people arrange for a private chef. This large room also had another toilet, shower and basin in a small closed area at the end. If you were entertaining  guests would not have to trapse through your bedroom. the bathroom was modern and looked fabulous with a spa. The pool was about 7 meters long, and was sparkling clean. We had 2 sun lounges. This area was shaded by a porch. The villas had a huge Gate/door leading out to the private paved alley that was shaded with bamboo curving over to form a canopy. This lead up to the main office.
Loved the stay not much to fault.
 Only downpoints were the smell of the drains were apparent in the bathroom. The staff did seem to leave the exhaust fans on when they serviced the rooms and the smell then dissipated a bit.
The breakfast included were brought to our villa  with a choice of 3 time slots decided the day prior. There was a bit of choice mainly eggs whichever way of nasi goreng & fruit, juices. If we ordered eggs also got a small basket with barely toasted  slices of bread and croissants with butters and various jams.
They were brought in on a huge tray and the staff set up the table etc which was great. The orange juice tasted like cordial so we bought our own long life version at supermarket.
we also took our own T-bags and bought long life milk.
Loved the Jineng but it is a 15 min walk to the beach.  Mardi was happy to drive us, A shuttle service is available to and from beach and local supermarket daily. We walked a lot and the staff will arrange taxis at night if required. We found the bluebird taxis less dodgey as they all have a metre.
Mozzies are a bit of an issue. We burnt mozzie coils out dusk, and always put on repellant before we went outside in the evening.
The free Wi-fi was good lost service twice but staff promptly recified the problem.
The rooms were serviced daily, fresh towels daily but not linen.
We thought they had forgotten about the free massage, but on about day 3 they mentioned it and the next morning 2 ladies came to our room at the time we booked and we both got a half hour foot massage.
We booked our accom on a special through the internet for $150 per night. Was pretty good value however would not have paid the supposed full price that was double.
title: Lovely private Villa

text:
This is our first trip to Bali for my birthday. The place is nice and pretty. Quiet. You can enjoy the private time there with your love ones. It's clean and the pool is big enough. I don't find mosquitoes or bugs (Lucky us :P) Staffs are polite and attentive. They will clean our room and on the air-con and lights for us. So everyday when we back to villa, it feels like home. Since I saw others comment about the safety box, so we are not leaving any valuable things at the villa. 

But if you really want to stay there, I have a few tips for you.

1. The location is far from main street so it's not convenient for food or shopping. And if you want to ask them to arrange the transport for you, you must mention to them you need Blue Bird taxi else they will call the community taxi for you (you can see them outside the villa) and they will charge you whatever they want (it's scary expensive)
2. The breakfast is ok but not much variety and the portion is quite small for a guy. They will order the food for you if you want. We tried once and it's not nice.
3. We have arranged the poolside dinner for my birthday. The dinner is not nice. Not worth for the price. You can get better dinner outside there. 

Overall, it was an ok staying but not fantastic as we expected. People are nice there but I think they need to be more organized and improve their food. It's quite wasted because it's really a beautiful and quiet place for relax and leisure trip.
title: First time to Bali

text:
i have no issue with bed sheets or the villa itself. breakfast is enough for both of us.. and we don't expect to eat rice or having table of buffet since we go out most of the time. 

the location is a little bit far from the main street, but, we have no issue since we hired a driver during our stay. The staff are all very friendly. I do agree with mosquitoes problem but that is no biggie. Please say hi to Evee the front desk staff.

thanks for the good experience and we will come back to the villa.
title: we love our villa

text:
Well,it was my first trip to Bali. We went to Jineng on our honeymoon for 7days, 10th March to 17th March. Flight was evening flight reached villa abt 1900hrs on first day, checkin at Jineng villa, staff was very polite and helpful.Recived welcoming juice also, villa located in a very quiet area not noisy just 5mins walk to main street of seminyak. Our one bedroom villa was awesome, very clean and tidy the swimming pool Too!! Made us smile the moment we stepped onto the villa. Settle down went out to the streets of seminyak, did a little bit of shopping and its always a must to rent a bike be it bali or phuket! So went back villa with a scrambler, the bike was our transport that took us around during our weeks stay riding around the amazing streets and beaches of Bali. 

The boring part was the honeymoon clashes with Bali nyepi day, that we cant actually go out for a day. But we manage to kill the boredom, movie marathon with room service and food and pool fun Haa! 
So a day of stay home thingy was pretty bored actually coz u cant go out at all, Tv channel was off too! 
(Wont go to bali on nyepi again.) 

For breakfast was good, they sent it to the room every morning just pick the available time they have and u when wanted,  you get to choose different food, juices everyday. The mee goreng and nasi goreng was pretty good! Thumbs up. Ordered room service food too was nice! Always love indonesian food. :) services frm the villa staff is good, very polite.
And also, we were caught in the heavy rain right when we went riding on last minute shopping before our trip to airport cause ours is a midnight flight on Qatar airways back home, came back to villa to get our bags, and the staff offered us a shower room too to dryed up ! Cool,  i think this practice in every hotel anywhere is good service. Keep it up! 
 
The days spend in Bali was amazing, went to seminyak & kuta streets and beaches, ku de ta restaurant for night dining, uluwatu, jinbaran beach for seafood many more i have forgotten. Haa! 
And also our one day tour guide "hendrix" that brought us around, on our last day. He was great!! 

And so a honeymoon well spend! 
The Jineng villa was like our home for that week, and im beginning to miss the villa already.We thanked all the staff that provided us their good service thruout our stay. 
We shall definitely come back to Bali and will definitely book The Jineng Villas again. Im looking forward for my next trip to Bali again. Sooon? I guess. :) 
Thumbs Up!
title: On Honeymoon.

text:
It was terrible experience to stay at this villa. 
Wife was down everyday. Breakfast was not filling at all and it is suppose to be chief cooking in your villa, however, I have never seen some one come to cook. Always have some people bring your cold meal to your place.
Staffs were unprofessional. Always has staffs set out side the villa talk with random people on the street. The whole place just looks like doggy!
We keep money in the safe and got lost for a quite huge amount. I believe it is not just me, at least happened couple times before according to tripadvistor other travelers review. I wish I had a chance read the review before I booked with this Villa. Unfortunately, I booked with other website which does not have review for the customer.Over all, it is very disappointed stay!
title: Terrible experience!!!!

text: We had a excellent five days stay at the villa with courteous and friendly service from one and all starting from the manager Mr Budi right down to the room staff to the driver who picked us up from and sent us back to the airport. Our villa was cleaned daily although the sheets were not changed daily since they were clean. This was not an issue for us since there was absolutely no need to chAnge sheets daily when they were clean just because we paid a daily rate for the room. Breakfast tho nothing much to shout about was generally acceptable and in line with expectations. Other services such as the Tv , Ac , Internet,jacuzzi , hot water in shower , operation of the indoor pool were all excellent.my daughter had such a wonderful time connecting to the Internet that she refuses to follow us out anywhere. My wife and I had difficulty connecting to the Internet because we were not IT savy like her . I assume many other travellers like my wife and I could experience the same problem because of their similar lack of IT knowledGe  unlike my daughter. This could lead them to the conclusion that the wifi services are down when they actually do not know how to make full use of the services . We did leave valuables in the room although not in the safe and nothing was removed although they were arranged neatly on our return. FInally  we would like to thank Mr Budi and his team of staff for having made our stay enjoyable and pleasant with their caring attitude and friendly advise whenever consulted. We wish them well and will definitely visit the Jineng again and hope to see them there. With kind regards . Simon and Sarah.
title: Great time at the Jineng

owner_response.text:
Dear Simon and Sarah 

Warm greeting from The Jineng Villas by Premier Hospitality Asia 

Thank you so much for your kind review , it is highly appreciated to hear this generous feedback toward our property. 
Hope you have enjoyed your stay at our villa and we do look forward to hosting in the near future , definitely with our better performance 

Many thanks and regards
Lismana
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Location: Exit being onto a back lane street evidently leads to 10 minute walk to reach any major road so taxi is only option here. Not to blame villa here, probably personal bad choice in locale.

Villa was clean and modern to say however still evidence of construction residue on most surfaces outside, inside was spotless in living areas. Toilets not so much.
Beds were comfortable unfortunately linen was not of the clean sort. Various stains and our blanket had what appeared to be a shoe tread marks. Linen not changed in 5 days there.

Mosquitoes were addressed it seams this time with the smellifier thing however lack of any adapter point for people visiting from places other then Indonesia was a problem. Trying to charge 3 phones and a laptop via single converter is not convenient in any way

Breakfast, as other have mentioned, was absolutely horrible. I don't know if you can call that a breakfast. Always arrive almost cold or cold. Seeing catering cars out front imagine it was made somewhere far way.

Wifi was down every day, having to repeatedly ask for it to be fixed during entire 5 days at least 2-3 times a day. Out of regular reception stuff of probably 4 different people one spoke English rest were just repeating what you said to them - explaining that wifi was down was problematic to the point where they just repeat exactly what you said and tell you to enter your password to fix it.

Here comes the disaster - this was a family holiday where we have arrived with wife from Australia and her parents from China bringing AUD$10,000 as present for wedding in cash. This was counted and locked up in a room safe. We have taken out the cash on the second last day however did not recount it and have consequently left to Australia. Upon arrival and visiting a bank for deposit only $7900 remained. $2100 was lifted from safe during only a few days stay. 
Word of advise is to not store anything of value in safe, jewelry or cash. Have card for your spend if you intend to stay there and having read other review (kicking self for not doing so prior) this is common occurrence.

A decent villa ruined by theft and absence of service. While rooms were kept clean and us tipping generously regularly, the theft is the lowest thing you can expect.
title: Good start, disaster finish.

owner_response.text:
Dear our Lovely Client 

Warm greeting from The Jineng Villas by Premier Hospitality Asia , 

Thank you so much for your kind feedback that is much valuable for our further improvement. After reading your review and investigating it toward our perspective, we are about to give our professional comment to put all the thing in its right place.

Here below is our Villa Manager report to our department:

Regarding Linen and Towels , our staff always change the Linen such as : sheets and blankets every 2 days during the guest staying. But they changed right way if the linens are dirty. Towels has been changed every day, yet for towels condition we transparently reveal that it is yes our towels are not as bright as what people see as bright white. We thank you so much to call us regarding this,hence we attempt to purchase new ones

Mosquitoes issue is actually our main problem due to tropical area, but we have regularly scheduled Terminix Pest control twice a months. And every turn down services, our staff always spray the mosquito sprayer in the room.

The Jineng sets up the electric converter at every villas, and has some spares at the office. If it does not work, the guest must call our front officer to change and report the case immediately. Our team will be very much glad to assist.

Regarding the standard of Breakfast, The Jineng has been ordering and purchasing several supporting equipment and valuing the portion of the breakfast itself since we are now hiring a new F&B product manager

WIFI, Internet connection is sometimes down at the Jineng, but our team never keeps it off , they always restart the modem and it works again ever since.Although it's a big crash on internet, we would be trying to resolve it immediately

For safety box, here is i quote what our manager stated regarding :
"I really surprised for this sensitive issue. If they lost their money at safety box during their staying, why they did not report to us immediately. So we can investigate at that time. your comment says: “We have taken out the cash on the second last day however DID NOT RECOUNT IT and consequently left to Australia.
What I catch from this statement is:  they took the money but never count it and never know how much they took.  And only the guest knows their locked combination. I have the Master key for the Safety box, but I always come to reopen whenever the guest call us if they have problems with the safety box. I never come to their Villa during their staying."

Hope the money matter is not our staff fault since ever we have provided the safety box for keeping all the guests' personal belonging inside it and keeping it locked. Nobody knows about the code combination, except the guest. Also such kind of cases should be solved on the site not after a guest arriving at their country, since we never know what has happened after the guest leaving the villa . Thus we could not proceed it into crime claim. 

Overall, we are highly appreciating your kind comment and it could help us to make a better improvement for future service 

Please do not hesitate to contact us should you require more assistance. We would be more than glad to assist

Many thanks and regards

Lismana
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Stayed here last year after going to Bali with friends for a holiday we had a few nights here ot end our vacation. The pool villas are lovely clean and private, I found staff to be very friendly and accommodating. The villas are in a convenient location meaning you can walk to great restaurants etc which is very handy in especially in Seminyak.
title: Clean villas, good location and friendly staff

text: Reasonably priced Villa with private pool. Wonderful ambience, great for retreats. Service kinda lagging i.e. shower not hot even after reporting, jacuzzi not functioning...other than that the staff are relatively nice :)
title: Hmmm...okay

text: We stayed in this villa with a few of my closest girlfriends. The service is great, location so-so but we had a driver so it was no problem. The only hiccup was that the staff had to retake our order even after we ordered it the night before. Everything is clean except for the usual tropical bugs which you cant get rid of.
title: Great villa, attentive staff, good value
